description: From republic +‎ -an, partly after French républicain.

adjectives.description: republican (comparative more republican, superlative most republican)

entries.meaning: Advocating or supporting a republic as a form of government, advocating or supporting republicanism. [from 17th c.]
examples: Republican ideology had no obvious institutional focus and ideological carrier as was the case with the discourse of reason (the monarchy) and the discourse of law (the parlements).

entries.meaning: Of or belonging to a republic. [from 17th c.]
Someone who favors a republic as a form of government. [from 17th c.]
A bird of a kind that builds many nests together: the American cliff swallow, or the South African weaver bird.
